tatami.pc.util.windowLayout

Class WindowLayout

  • java.lang.Object
    • tatami.pc.util.windowLayout.WindowLayout

  • public class WindowLayout
extends java.lang.Object
    Provides support for the automatic layout of windows. Unimplemented: TODO: support for multiple screens TODO: avoiding bars on all sides
    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

    • Constructor Detail

      • WindowLayout

        public WindowLayout(int globalWidth,
            int globalHeight,
            LayoutIndications ind,
            MultipleDisplaySupport mds)
        Constructs a new WindowLayout instance. It will manage the parameters (placement, size) for windows that are created vie getWindow and dropWindow.
        Parameters:
        globalWidth - : the area allocated to this layout; width.
        globalHeight - : the area allocated to this layout; width.
        ind - : a LayoutIndications structure that gives general indications for the layout (optional).
        mds - : a MultipleDisplaySupport structure that gives information on a multiple display setup (optional). Not Implemented.

    • Method Detail

      • getWindow

        public WindowParameters getWindow(java.lang.String type,
                         java.lang.String name,
                         LayoutIndications indications)
        Creates an allocation for a new window. The allocated space will remain associated with the window until dropWindow is called.

        Window name and type are just String used to identify the window internally, but two allocations with the same type and name cannot be created (the same allocation will be returned). Type can also help get indications specified when initializing the layout (via LayoutIndications.indicateWindowType.

        The function will always return a not-null instance. If no allocation can be made in the layout, a default window is returned.

        Parameters:
        type - the type of the window used to identify potential indications.
        name - the name of the window, used to identify it (together with type).
        indications - particular indications for this window; these override the indications for the global layout.
        Returns:
        the parameters for the newly allocated space, in the form of a WindowParameters instance.

      • dropWindow

        public void dropWindow(WindowParameters params)
        Deallocates the space for a window.
        Parameters:
        params - the parameters of the window (must be the same instance returned by getWindow())

      • dropWindow

      • doexit

        public void doexit()
        Removes all allocations, and shuts down the log. The instance is unusable after this call.
